data.value: Functions that mutate the passed object can produce unexpected behavior or errors and are not supported. See

Function to use for transforming the data. If a function, must either work when passed a DataFrame or when passed to DataFrame.apply. If func is both list-like and dict-like, dict-like behavior takes precedence.
list-like of functions and/or function names, e.g.
dict-like of axis labels -> functions, function names or list-like of such.
If 0 or 'index': apply function to each column. If 1 or 'columns': apply function to each row.

children.type_: If the returned DataFrame has a different length than self.

data.value: A DataFrame that must have the same length as self.
on self producing a DataFrame with the same axis shape as self.
Even though the resulting DataFrame must have the same length as the input DataFrame, it is possible to provide several input functions:
You can call transform on a GroupBy object:

data.out:
c type
0  1    m
1  1    n
2  1    o
3  2    m
4  2    m
5  2    n
6  2    n

c type size
0  1    m    3
1  1    n    3
2  1    o    3
3  2    m    4
4  2    m    4
5  2    n    4
6  2    n    4
